programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: Eleven years after Connecticut mother Donna Palomba is raped in her home, investigators finally track down her attacker; Donna speaks out about the latest developments in the case, including her fight to keep her assailant from walking free.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: A daughter finds her father, a former FBI agent, murdered at his house; police dig into the man's past and begin to think the key to the mystery might be quite close to home.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: After trumpet player Scott Sessions fails to show up for a scheduled gig, his family learns his body was abandoned in the remote Colorado Rockies; as the investigation narrows in on two suspects, a second murder catches police by surprise.

programme.title: Sins of the City
programme.desc: In Oklahoma City, a member of law enforcement is caught using his position of power to prey upon numerous black women within the city until his last victim, a 57-year-old grandmother, steps up and speaks out against his reign of terror.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When a woman is found viciously stabbed to death in her bed, suspicions fall on an ex-boyfriend. But the case takes a bizarre twist, when the ex is gunned down, and the investigation turns to an estranged husband whose love runs deep.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: The disappearance of a young mother and her three-year-old son turns a small southern town upside-down. Family members are quick to suspect foul play has befallen this devoted mother of two, and as night falls with no sign of their return, the community bands together in the search effort. Will rescuers be able to reach them in time or will it be too late?

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When a Miami man�s wife reports him missing, police set out to learn what happened to him. Soon, they�ll learn troubling secrets of addiction and infidelity. But when a foul odor permeates the neighborhood, they wonder if the truth is closer to home.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: The murder of a new mother shocks a quiet community, especially when investigators learn that her estranged Army sergeant husband has an airtight alibi. But soon, a twisted love triangle emerges, one in which another young woman will cross the line for her man � no matter the cost.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: Police are stunned when two young men are brutally gunned down in their own backyard. A search for the killer sends investigators into the tempestuous world of a desperate and heartbroken lover, and a complex web of lies that conceals the heinous truth.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: When detectives in Lubbock, Texas respond to an early-morning robbery turned homicide, they�re not sure at first where to start looking for the killer. Soon, surveillance video and an anonymous tip will lead them to a dangerous young man, and the girlfriend who was willing to go to any lengths to hide her man�s secret.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: A beautiful, young woman has the world at her fingertips until a charming, bad boy sweeps her off her feet.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: After escaping a bad relationship, a young woman thinks she finally found Mr. Right. But soon, she realizes her new man is actually worse than her ex.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When the body of a college student is found in an open grave, her family is sure she was strangled by a boyfriend with a history of mental illness. But he has an airtight alibi; could someone in her circle of friends be the one who wanted her dead?

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When a woman is found lying in a pool of blood in her kitchen, her siblings immediately suspect who is responsible. Their lead adds surprising twists to the investigation, and detectives expose a fatal love triangle, violent pasts, and deep rage.

programme.title: Atlanta Homicide
programme.desc: On a hot summer night in early August, two assailants attempt to rob a man’s house, who is rumored to have a great deal of cash within his house. As events unfold, a simple robbery ends up leaving a young, engaged couple murdered. Quinn and Velazquez are assigned the case only to discover that time wasn’t on the young couple’s side.

programme.title: Atlanta Homicide
programme.desc: When an elderly man, Edward, who always paid his rent on time, failed to do so, the apartment manager calls in a welfare check. As it turns out, Edward was tortured and murdered inside his apartment. Quinn and Vince hightail it to the scene and upon investigating, soon realize murder is not always accomplished…alone.

programme.title: Payback
programme.desc: When a man loses control of his wife and kids, he goes to murderous lengths to get revenge.

programme.title: Sins of the City
programme.desc: In Scottsdale, Arizona, women in the city fall prey a handsome playboy who enjoys the party lifestyle as one of city’s rich and famous. But when the FBI learns he’s a serial grifter running an investment scam, the party’s over.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When a retired Chicago steelworker is gunned down outside his home, police suspect he was targeted by a street gang in retaliation for reporting crimes in the neighborhood. But when the victim’s daughter follows her own suspicions, she finds a tangled web of deceit with a conspiracy that could ensnare the people closest to her.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When a Miami man�s wife reports him missing, police set out to learn what happened to him. Soon, they�ll learn troubling secrets of addiction and infidelity. But when a foul odor permeates the neighborhood, they wonder if the truth is closer to home.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: The murder of a new mother shocks a quiet community, especially when investigators learn that her estranged Army sergeant husband has an airtight alibi. But soon, a twisted love triangle emerges, one in which another young woman will cross the line for her man � no matter the cost.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: Police are stunned when two young men are brutally gunned down in their own backyard. A search for the killer sends investigators into the tempestuous world of a desperate and heartbroken lover, and a complex web of lies that conceals the heinous truth.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: When detectives in Lubbock, Texas respond to an early-morning robbery turned homicide, they�re not sure at first where to start looking for the killer. Soon, surveillance video and an anonymous tip will lead them to a dangerous young man, and the girlfriend who was willing to go to any lengths to hide her man�s secret.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: A beautiful, young woman has the world at her fingertips until a charming, bad boy sweeps her off her feet.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: After escaping a bad relationship, a young woman thinks she finally found Mr. Right. But soon, she realizes her new man is actually worse than her ex.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When the body of a college student is found in an open grave, her family is sure she was strangled by a boyfriend with a history of mental illness. But he has an airtight alibi; could someone in her circle of friends be the one who wanted her dead?

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When a woman is found lying in a pool of blood in her kitchen, her siblings immediately suspect who is responsible. Their lead adds surprising twists to the investigation, and detectives expose a fatal love triangle, violent pasts, and deep rage.

programme.title: Atlanta Homicide
programme.desc: On a hot summer night in early August, two assailants attempt to rob a man’s house, who is rumored to have a great deal of cash within his house. As events unfold, a simple robbery ends up leaving a young, engaged couple murdered. Quinn and Velazquez are assigned the case only to discover that time wasn’t on the young couple’s side.

programme.title: Atlanta Homicide
programme.desc: When an elderly man, Edward, who always paid his rent on time, failed to do so, the apartment manager calls in a welfare check. As it turns out, Edward was tortured and murdered inside his apartment. Quinn and Vince hightail it to the scene and upon investigating, soon realize murder is not always accomplished…alone.

programme.title: Payback
programme.desc: When a man loses control of his wife and kids, he goes to murderous lengths to get revenge.

programme.title: Sins of the City
programme.desc: In Scottsdale, Arizona, women in the city fall prey a handsome playboy who enjoys the party lifestyle as one of city’s rich and famous. But when the FBI learns he’s a serial grifter running an investment scam, the party’s over.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When a retired Chicago steelworker is gunned down outside his home, police suspect he was targeted by a street gang in retaliation for reporting crimes in the neighborhood. But when the victim’s daughter follows her own suspicions, she finds a tangled web of deceit with a conspiracy that could ensnare the people closest to her.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When a 27-year-old pregnant woman is found brutally stabbed to death in her Bedford, Texas apartment, police are tasked with solving a double murder and wondering who could have left them for dead? However, it’s not until police locate her missing boyfriend that they realize they’re facing a case more complicated than anyone could have imagined.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: After single mother, Shania Copeland, and her neighbor, Leotis Lester, are shot dead, detectives use witness testimony and surveillance to piece together the truth behind a senseless crime that never should have been committed.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: When a series of brazen, armed robberies strike local businesses in a tranquil community in Wisconsin, detectives find themselves with few clues to help them identify the perpetrators. That is, until police track down real-life Bonnie and Clyde willing to risk it all in the name of love.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: A gifted high school cheerleader�s bright plans for the future turn dark when she falls in love with an up-and-coming rapper and ex-con. Before long, she finds herself going down a road to trouble by hiding her relationship and risking her future in order to appease her man.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: When a woman unlucky in love meets a smooth-talking older man, she thinks she has finally found someone to start a life with. But when detectives come knocking on her door after a woman goes missing, they discover a woman willing to do whatever it took to keep her man satisfied.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: A beautiful young bank teller falls head over heels for a starving musician. Under his spell, she becomes willing to risk it all.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: A young woman is looking for a fresh start when she falls for a handsome stranger. When her new man asks for her help in a dangerous plot to make some quick cash, she decides to risk it all for love.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When a young mother of four is found murdered in her home, police initially wonder if a stalker is to blame. But a routine traffic stop in another state will ultimately reveal a killer � and kidnapper � who would do anything to get away with murder.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe
programme.desc: When a popular local DJ is gunned down, the community is stunned as to who would want to kill him. With the help of surveillance footage and phone records, detectives will soon find deep-rooted jealousy and a master manipulator are to blame.

programme.title: Atlanta Homicide
programme.desc: Demetrius Robbins was a stand-up husband and father who made it a point to serve his family, until one night where the unthinkable happened. Quinn and Vince go from a crime scene where there is no body, to rapidly piecing together that Demetrius Robbins is the victim in a much larger and horrific crime that they never could have imagined.

programme.title: Atlanta Homicide
programme.desc: Jimmie Atkins was well-liked by everyone in his neighborhood. Days pass and no one had seen or heard from him which was quite uncharacteristic. The APD were called and they discovered that he was murdered inside his own home. Quinn and Vince rush to the scene only to discover that people who you love and hold dearest to your heart, can make it stop beating.

programme.title: Payback
programme.desc: After a deady night-time home invasion, the family suspects a vindictive ex-lover, but the case grows cold after the suspect disappears; thirty years later, a family member hungry for justice helps police track down the vengeful killer.

programme.title: Sins of the City

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe

But nothing about this case is what it seems, and the jaw-dropping truth will redefine the meaning of calculation and cruelty.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction-Dupe

But on the threshold of achieving his goals he’s gunned down outside his Cleveland, Ohio home. programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.title: Storms of the Century

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: In this episode we meet the animals of Africa. We'll see how the zebra is able to use its stripes as camouflage against its colorblind nemesis. Explore the engineering of a giraffe's neck, and feel the power of a hyena's jaws.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: An Elephant seals nose inflates to amplify its roar, which can be heard up to a mile away! Plus, African wild dog have one of the most powerful bite forces on Earth! Giant ant eaters w/o teeth have 2 foot long tongues and can eat 30k insects per day!

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau explores the natural beauty of the Canadian Rockies. Philippe canoes on the famous, glacier-fed Lake Louise at Banff National Park. We hike up a glacier at Jasper National Park and discover much more.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Philippe visits an estuary in North Carolina and catches blue crabs, which have adapted to both saltwater and freshwater. Then Philippe goes to Curacao and takes a submersible 500 feet below the surface to look at sea life. Later, a trip to NASA.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Rabbi Fred Neulander was a pillar of his Cherry Hill, New Jersey community - the founder of a synagogue, a father and a husband. Little did anyone know, he was also an adulterer, one capable of hiring a hitman to murder his own wife.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Melanie McGuire made a living bringing life into the world as a fertility clinic nurse; the police accused her of shooting her husband, dismembering his body and disposing of it in suitcases dumped into the Chesapeake Bay.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: In Silverthorne, Colorado, a photographer's wife seems to have mysteriously vanished in the night, until detectives learn he has a violent past; in Darby, Montana, a husband is dead, and Police have two suspects - his wife and mistress.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs

programme.title: Murderous Affairs

programme.title: NFL Daily
programme.desc: Gregg Rosenthal and a rotating crew of elite NFL Media co-hosts, including Patrick Claybon, Colleen Wolfe, Steve Wyche, Nick Shook and Jourdan Rodrigue of The Athletic get viewers caught up daily on all the NFL news and analysis.

programme.title: NFL GameDay View
programme.desc: Hosts Patrick Claybon, Cynthia Frelund, Gregg Rosenthal provide analysis and predictions, also receive insight from reporters around the country and in-depth statistical analysis ahead of Divisioanl Round during the 2025 NFL season.

programme.title: Weekly Game Previews
programme.desc: This weekly series breaks down what you need to know for every NFL matchup ahead of Divisional Round from the 2025 NFL season.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Relive the 2003 NFC Divisional matchup between the Carolina Panthers and the St. Louis Rams where the games goes into overtime after a beautiful on side kick for the Rams, then Carolina wins with a walk-off 69-yard touchdown from Steve Smith, one of the most iconic plays in franchise history.

programme.title: Condensed Game
programme.desc: Green Bay Packers and the Dallas Cowboys by watching Aaron Rodgers throw a 36-yard pass to a toe-dragging Jared Cook on the sideline, and Mason Crosby kicked a 51-yard field goal as time expired, which sent the Packers to the NFC Championship Game.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Saquon Barkley dashed through the snow for two touchdown runs and finished with 205 yards rushing, Jalen Hurts had a 44-yard scoring run and the Eagles held on against the turnover-happy Rams 28-22 on Sunday to reach the NFC championship game.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen put together his first career game-winning drive in the fourth quarter or overtime in the playoffs, thanks to some help from his defense and specifically veteran cornerback Tre'Davious White.

programme.title: Weekly Game Previews
programme.desc: This weekly series breaks down what you need to know for every NFL matchup ahead of Divisional Round from the 2025 NFL season.

programme.title: NFL Game Center Live
programme.desc: Get live NFL scores, highlights, news, and more throughout the 2025 NFL Playoffs.

programme.title: Weekly Game Recaps
programme.desc: Weekly highlight series featuring the biggest moments and best plays from the Divisional Round of the 2025 NFL season.

programme.title: NFL Throwback
programme.desc: What happens when an all-time receiving corps faces off against a dominant secondary? NFL Throwback breaks down a matchup between the 1998 Vikings and 2013 Seahawks.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Patrick Mahomes and Travis Kelce topple Josh Allen and the Bills in another post season classic. The Chiefs move on to the AFC Championship game for the sixth straight year following a Tyler Bass missed kick to tie the game with under two minutes remaining which ended up leading to a 27-24 Kansas City victory.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Goff threw his second touchdown pass with 6:22 left and the Lions beat the Tampa Bay Buccaneers 31-23 in the divisional round on Sunday.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Dallas Cowboys play the San Francisco 49ers at Levi's® Stadium on January 22, 2023.

programme.title: Losing Is Worse Than Death | The Bill Tierney Documentary
programme.desc: Coach Bill Tierney is a legend. Over his five decade coaching career, he's accomplished almost everything: NCAA Championships, Coach of the Year honors, induction into the Hall of Fame. The last accomplishment left for his resume? A PLL Championship. Philadelphia finished 2-8 in Coach Tierney's inaugural year at the helm. Now in his second season, Tierney is aiming to right the ship and has his sights on one more ring.

programme.title: Pregame Plates presented by Whirlpool
programme.desc: Jerry Ragonese, a 13-year pro lacrosse vet turned elite chef is taking his talents, and his long-time friends, into the kitchen. Cooking up epic dishes while uncovering the stories behind the meals that made the lacrosse stars of today.

programme.title: Outlaws
programme.desc: The Lacrosse Network Presents a look into on the 2012 Denver Outlaws Training camp, their first memories of lacrosse, the sounds of the game, and a recap of their Championship game with RJ Kaminski.

programme.title: Going West
programme.desc: University of Utah turns club lacrosse into NCAA lacrosse team

programme.title: Chicago Needs a PLL Team | All-Access Vlog
programme.desc: RJ takes you behind the scenes of the jam packed Chicago PLL weekend in an all-access video.

programme.title: 2025 Golden Stick Award Race
programme.desc: The Golden Stick Award is an award given to the player who accumulates the most scoring points throughout the Championship Series. In its history, the winner has been on the team who lost the championship title. This year we followed four of the best goal scorers in the world through their quest to be the first player to win the Championship Series trophy and the Golden Stick Award.

programme.title: University of Texas Documentary
programme.desc: 3 years ago, pro lacrosse player Kyle Hartzell stepped on the campus of University of Texas at Austin as their new club lacrosse team head coach. Now they are a top MCLA program competing for championships. TLN went to Austin, TX during the most anticipated game of the Longhorn's season to uncover what makes their program so special.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Joey Spallina - Paul Carcaterra visits Syracuse, N.Y. to pull back the curtain on the biggest name in College Lacrosse: Joey Spallina. In this episode of THROUGH X, Spallina speaks on wearing the No. 22 at Syracuse, shares his goal to return the Orange to NCAA Championship glory, and shows you how to score his signature behind-the-back goal.

programme.title: TLN Facility Tours
programme.desc: Johns Hopkins & Clemson: Explore two top-tier lacrosse programs as TLN takes you inside their world-class facilities. Visit Johns Hopkins in Baltimore, MD, home to the legendary Blue Jays, and tour the iconic Cordish Lacrosse Center and Homewood Field. Then, head to Clemson, SC, for an exclusive look at the nation's premier women's lacrosse facilities.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Paul Carcaterra heads to Evanston, IL to visit with Northwestern's Izzy Scane. Izzy has been a dominant force for the Wildcats since she first arrived on campus. With a National title, the Tewaaraton Award winner, and record shattering season – she has cemented herself as an all-time great. We also went to Charlottesville, VA to dissect the elite game of Connor Shellenberger: a hometown hero, and arguably the best player in history for the University of Virginia.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: We head to Denver, CO to profile Ethan Walker: arguably the greatest shooter in college lacrosse. While also uncovering why the storied success of the Denver program has been fueled by top Canadian talent. We also went to Princeton to uncover the speed and power of Michael Sowers: An attackman who's mental approach to the game has risen him to record-breaking success within a program built on legendary offensive lacrosse players.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: We travel to Loyola University to breakdown the basketball influenced playing style of Pat Spencer – While storying his evolution to becoming arguably the best playmaker in college lacrosse. We also travel to Albany to explore the Danes' attack factory led by Connor Fields and Tehoka Nanticoke this spring. We learn how these guys came to lacrosse, the coaching philosophy of Scott Marr, and how the Thompsons laid the groundwork for a new style of play in upstate New York.

programme.title: 2024 Player's Top 50 Fueled by Gatorade
programme.desc: Join Paul Carcaterra and Ryan Boyle in studio as they break down this year's Player's Top 50 Fueled by Gatorade.

programme.title: Losing Is Worse Than Death | The Bill Tierney Documentary
programme.desc: Coach Bill Tierney is a legend. Over his five decade coaching career, he's accomplished almost everything: NCAA Championships, Coach of the Year honors, induction into the Hall of Fame. The last accomplishment left for his resume? A PLL Championship. Philadelphia finished 2-8 in Coach Tierney's inaugural year at the helm. Now in his second season, Tierney is aiming to right the ship and has his sights on one more ring.

programme.title: Pregame Plates presented by Whirlpool
programme.desc: Jerry Ragonese, a 13-year pro lacrosse vet turned elite chef is taking his talents, and his long-time friends, into the kitchen. Cooking up epic dishes while uncovering the stories behind the meals that made the lacrosse stars of today.

programme.title: Outlaws
programme.desc: The Lacrosse Network Presents a look into on the 2012 Denver Outlaws Training camp, their first memories of lacrosse, the sounds of the game, and a recap of their Championship game with RJ Kaminski.

programme.title: Going West
programme.desc: University of Utah turns club lacrosse into NCAA lacrosse team

programme.title: Chicago Needs a PLL Team | All-Access Vlog
programme.desc: RJ takes you behind the scenes of the jam packed Chicago PLL weekend in an all-access video.

programme.title: 2025 Golden Stick Award Race
programme.desc: The Golden Stick Award is an award given to the player who accumulates the most scoring points throughout the Championship Series. In its history, the winner has been on the team who lost the championship title. This year we followed four of the best goal scorers in the world through their quest to be the first player to win the Championship Series trophy and the Golden Stick Award.

programme.title: University of Texas Documentary
programme.desc: 3 years ago, pro lacrosse player Kyle Hartzell stepped on the campus of University of Texas at Austin as their new club lacrosse team head coach. Now they are a top MCLA program competing for championships. TLN went to Austin, TX during the most anticipated game of the Longhorn's season to uncover what makes their program so special.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Joey Spallina - Paul Carcaterra visits Syracuse, N.Y. to pull back the curtain on the biggest name in College Lacrosse: Joey Spallina. In this episode of THROUGH X, Spallina speaks on wearing the No. 22 at Syracuse, shares his goal to return the Orange to NCAA Championship glory, and shows you how to score his signature behind-the-back goal.

programme.title: TLN Facility Tours
programme.desc: Johns Hopkins & Clemson: Explore two top-tier lacrosse programs as TLN takes you inside their world-class facilities. Visit Johns Hopkins in Baltimore, MD, home to the legendary Blue Jays, and tour the iconic Cordish Lacrosse Center and Homewood Field. Then, head to Clemson, SC, for an exclusive look at the nation's premier women's lacrosse facilities.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Paul Carcaterra heads to Evanston, IL to visit with Northwestern's Izzy Scane. Izzy has been a dominant force for the Wildcats since she first arrived on campus. With a National title, the Tewaaraton Award winner, and record shattering season – she has cemented herself as an all-time great. We also went to Charlottesville, VA to dissect the elite game of Connor Shellenberger: a hometown hero, and arguably the best player in history for the University of Virginia.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: We head to Denver, CO to profile Ethan Walker: arguably the greatest shooter in college lacrosse. While also uncovering why the storied success of the Denver program has been fueled by top Canadian talent. We also went to Princeton to uncover the speed and power of Michael Sowers: An attackman who's mental approach to the game has risen him to record-breaking success within a program built on legendary offensive lacrosse players.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: We travel to Loyola University to breakdown the basketball influenced playing style of Pat Spencer – While storying his evolution to becoming arguably the best playmaker in college lacrosse. We also travel to Albany to explore the Danes' attack factory led by Connor Fields and Tehoka Nanticoke this spring. We learn how these guys came to lacrosse, the coaching philosophy of Scott Marr, and how the Thompsons laid the groundwork for a new style of play in upstate New York.

He attempts to escape as Sutton's henchmen pursue him, and is soon joined by a half-Mexican woman named Maria (Natalie Wood), whose father had also been killed by Sutton. programme.desc: The actor and comedian discusses his hilarious day-to-day observations, including how dating Jennifer Love Hewitt has impacted his life.

programme.desc: The popular comedian tells deeply personal stories from his fascinating life and presents his famously funny celebrity impressions and observations.

programme.title: Earthquake: (Practice) the Secret Files of Earthquake
programme.desc: Earthquake brings his hilarious and straightforward signature comedic style to his all-new stand-up special that you won’t want to miss.

programme.title: Sinbad: Where U Been
programme.desc: Sinbad hits the stage hard as he speaks truth to the burning subjects of the day, from poverty and politics to where he's been keeping himself.

programme.title: Sinbad: Make Me Wanna Holla
programme.desc: A stand-up special covering the everything from the life advice his parents gave him to people with no talent having clothing lines and more.

programme.title: Henry Rollins: Keep Talking, Pal
programme.desc: The comedian, actor, writer, and musician discusses a chance encounter with David Bowie, the genius of RuPaul, and more in this hilarious set.

programme.title: Dominique Witten: Stop Me When I'm Lying!
programme.desc: The stand up comic, actress, and “Chappelle's Show" performer gives her signature hot takes regarding the life and times of a modern comedian.

programme.title: Andrew Dice Clay: One Night With Dice
programme.desc: A rare stand-up set and Q&A session with Andrew Dice Clay, performed at a Philly comedy club before he hit it big on the comedy and TV circuit.

programme.title: Gary Owen: Breakin' Out the Park
programme.desc: In this brutally honest stand-up performance, comedian Gary Owen confesses his hilarious history of growing up in and around trailer parks.

programme.title: Gary Owen: #DoinWhatIDo
programme.desc: The so-called “Funniest Serviceman in America” draws from his multiracial experience to lambast culture wars on social media and in his own home.

programme.title: Gary Owen: Black Famous
programme.desc: This last year has been unlike any other: COVID, lockdowns, and for Gary, it has also included a divorce and family insanity unlike any other; up until now, Gary hasn't been able to speak about what really happened.

programme.title: Iliza Shlesinger: War Paint
programme.desc: Iliza Shlesinger performs her first stand-up special in her hometown of Dallas, Texas.

programme.title: Keep Your Distance: Vol. 17
programme.desc: KevOnStage hosts a night of stand-up comedy featuring Tony Valentino and Brennon Edwards.

programme.title: Keep Your Distance: Vol. 18
programme.desc: KevOnStage hosts a night of stand-up comedy featuring Tony Valentino and Brennon Edwards.

programme.title: Tim Allen: ReWires America
programme.desc: Tim Allen grunts, he burps, he soups up his lawnmower and he's damn proud of it! Filled with family bits as well as the stuff we've come to love him for: tools, engine and cars. In this 1991 special, we see the Tim Allen we grew to love.

programme.title: Tim Allen: Men Are Pigs
programme.desc: In this special from 1990, Tim Allen proves men are pigs as he discusses family and the differences between women and men. In "Men are Pigs" , you see the groundwork for his successful show, "Home Improvement".

programme.title: Trevor Noah: African American
programme.desc: Trevor Noah explores his bewildering journey of growing up a mixed-race child under apartheid, arriving in America, and simply wanting to be Black.

programme.title: Tom Green Live!
programme.desc: MTV's prankster Tom Green brings his outrageous energy and irreverent wit from "The Tom Green Show" to the stage in his first stand-up special.

programme.title: Jimmy O. Yang: Guess How Much?
programme.desc: Yang dives into love languages, loser friends and negotiating with his Asian parents.

programme.title: Jimmy O. Yang: Good Deal
programme.desc: The Silicon Valley star uses his debut stand-up special to discuss tall women, disappointing his parents, and how he learned English from rap videos.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: An ER doctor's friend arrives at the hospital combative and out of control, attacking the doctor in the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A doctor with a severe bee allergy is stung while treating a critical patient who's been stabbed in the eye; a man comes into the ER after slitting his own throat; a paramedic becomes a patient when she's struck by a mysterious illness.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: The ER becomes a dangerous place when smuggled drugs are found in a patient's belly.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER: Temptations
programme.desc: A man comes into the ER with a surprising body part stuck inside a camping stove.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER: Baby 911
programme.desc: Parents bring in a young woman with stomach pain, but they don't know she is pregnant.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A circus sword-swallower suffers from a persistent case of hiccups; a mother and daughter mysteriously collapse in the ER; a woman loses control of her legs at her daughter's graduation.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A wrist fracture turns into a medical mystery. Two fishermen get stuck on the same lure.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A pianist's finger is accidentally sawed off, a man's pacemaker is killing him yet keeping him alive and more.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: An ER physician races to determine why a young woman is burning up from the inside out after a beach visit.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A pregnant woman's leg pain turns out to be flesh-eating virus, threatening life and limb; a Desert Storm war veteran swallows razor blades on a dare; a bride-to-be spends her wedding day in the ER after collapsing at the altar.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A woman complaining of abdominal pain finds out that she is in fact pregnant.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A patient is brought into the ER after being shot in the thigh.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A six-year-old girl is rushed to the ER with intermittent seizures.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A mugging victim arrives with two bullet wounds to the brain.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: The force of a tornado drove a fence picket through Julie's neck.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man is bitten by a deadly rattlesnake but because of religious reasons cannot receive a blood transfusion.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Doctors must decide whether to put a hole in a teenager's head or wait for more help.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man goes into anaphylactic shock, a tough guy fears needles and a man stabs himself with a ninja sword.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Doctors perform a chest incision while awaiting surgeons. An iguana is brought in following a car accident.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's programme Gordon finds a chef caught in a time warp when he tackles a picturesque but largely unfrequented upmarket restaurant in King's Lynn, a traditional market town on the Norfolk coast. For the last eighteen months ex Michelin-starred chef Nick has owned and run Rococo but his past success is now eluding him. The menu is past its sell-by date, the service is stuffy, the food is over-priced and the only thing being fed is his ego. Yet, despite debts of ~£100k and the prospect of putting his home at risk and his young family on the streets, Nick continues to cook comatose in a 1990s fantasy land of his own making.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's final programme of the series Gordon grapples with girl power when he takes on an intimate family-run restaurant in the heart of WAG territory near Liverpool. For the last three years Morgan's has been run by antiques dealer-turned-restaurateur SANDY and her two daughters HELEN and LAURA. The beautifully-designed dining room has a prime high street location and should be the perfect eatery for the trendy local clientele. But Head Chef Phil is grappling with an eclectic menu that includes mashed potato with apricots and his cooking's just not up to it.

In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty travels to two corners of the country where the challenges he faces are very different. On the south coast he is presented with a front garden ravaged by salty winds, and in Snowdonia he helps a mountainside garden.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty helps two families create dream gardens that are as much for the children as for the adults. In Doncaster, Nikki and John want a garden full of edible plants and fruit.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty faces some of the most surprising plans yet - a Norwegian garden complete with waterfalls to be fashioned out of a tiny back yard in Dorset, and nothing less than a Japanese tea garden to be created out of a patch of ground in Bromley.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his favourite winter veg, Joe Swift discovers AJ Odudu's passion for houseplants, and Sue Kent and Toby Buckland take an inspirational trip to Piet Oudolf's garden in Somerset.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill and the team continue to celebrate the joy that the gardening year brings; Rachel de Thame visits Anglesey Abbey; Arit Anderson discovers how rewilding can increase biodiversity.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost demonstrates how to build a rose arch, mulches his beds and plants a blackcurrant to train up a fence. Frances Tophill visits RHS Wisley in Surrey to witness the seasonal colour that heathers can provide in the winter months.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets involved in more seasonal tasks at Longmeadow. Carol Klein celebrates the spring highlights at Beth Chatto's Gardens in Essex, and Toby Buckland is in Cornwall to meet a gardener who fell out of love with gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares for his spring display and tackles slippery paths, Carol Klein visits a collection of Michaelmas daisies and we visit a veg grower with a show-stopping Halloween pumpkin.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: We find out how Rachel de Thame got on over the past year as she attempted to grow her own cut flowers, and if you're still in a quandary about what to grow in your winter pots this year, Monty Don may well have the answer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Bonfire Night in mind, Monty Don turns his attention to the firecracker colours of spring when he begins to tidy up his herbaceous plants to make room to plant tulip bulbs. As well as recommending varieties for an early display, he also shows what to plant now under the shade of trees for colour next year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has tips and ideas for planting up garden pots to provide a focal point over the winter months, Rachel visits the tulips of Keukenhof, Joe visits Esther Rantzen's much-loved garden, and Carol visits Glebe Cottage.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Halloween just round the corner, Monty Don is harvesting his pumpkins and showing how to store them for roasts, soups and stews in the coming months. Joe Swift visits a high end garden in West London to get some tips on how clever landscaping and the use of lighting can turn a small space into an outdoor room which can be used all year round.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his loofahs, plants tulip bulbs in pots, gives a masterclass in making leafmould and reflects on the gardening year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes some practical steps to protect tender plants as the first frosts of the year begin to bite. He also starts preparing for next spring, planting tulips, pansies and apple trees and sharing his advice on training step-over apples and planting out wallflowers from seed. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage demonstrating how to grow plants from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This time there's plenty to do to prepare for the season to come and Monty Don is clearing out spent crops and mulching his asparagus. Joe Swift's been to visit keen gardeners, Wayne and Geraldine Hemingway, to see how they combine sustainability with their designer-style. Carol Klein's exploring the history of the rose at Coughton Court, one of our best rose gardens and Monty plants a new rose of his own. What happens when you have to downsize and leave your much-loved garden?

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme comes from all four of the Royal Horticultural Society gardens, where the team are out on the road exploring how each location's differing climate affects the plants they grow. Carol Klein broadcasts from Wisley in Surrey. In the garden at Harlow Carr in Yorkshire, Joe Swift gets plenty of propagating tips. Rachel de Thame explores the gardens at Hyde Hall in Essex, and Monty Don visits Rosemoor in Devon.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his favourite winter veg, Joe Swift discovers AJ Odudu's passion for houseplants, and Sue Kent and Toby Buckland take an inspirational trip to Piet Oudolf's garden in Somerset.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty tackles three seasons of gardening when he makes additions to his spring garden, gives advice on how to dry and preserve herbs for winter and plants up a container to give interest from now until spring. Carol celebrates one of the plant successes of an extraordinary summer, the Canna while Frances Tophill tackles a viewer's garden and suggests plants which will perform throughout the winter. Toby Buckland visits a garden in Devon with Japanese influences.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost demonstrates how to build a rose arch, mulches his beds and plants a blackcurrant to train up a fence. Frances Tophill visits RHS Wisley in Surrey to witness the seasonal colour that heathers can provide in the winter months.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants a mix of white flowers in the writing garden, demonstrates how to prune a climbing rose and reviews what's been happening in the vegetable garden. Adam Frost celebrates seasonal colour on a visit to a garden in Essex, and Sue Kent pots up allium bulbs in readiness for spring and replants a tricky border with lavender she's grown from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Bonfire Night in mind, Monty Don turns his attention to the firecracker colours of spring when he begins to tidy up his herbaceous plants to make room to plant tulip bulbs. As well as recommending varieties for an early display, he also shows what to plant now under the shade of trees for colour next year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the days get shorter, it is a busy time in the garden. Monty Don cracks on with his seasonal tasks at Longmeadow, giving hints and tips along the way. Carol Klein visits first-time gardeners Dan and Dominique for the very last time.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: We find out how Rachel de Thame got on over the past year as she attempted to grow her own cut flowers, and if you're still in a quandary about what to grow in your winter pots this year, Monty Don may well have the answer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: After an extraordinary season, Monty's orchard has a bountiful harvest of apples and he gives advice on how to pick and store them. Frances Tophill makes a final visit to her shared allotment and joins in with the festivities at their annual show. Adam Frost visits the RHS garden Wisley where he meets the Curator to discuss the effects of summer. Nick Bailey investigates knotweed, one of the most pernicious weeds in the UK, Arit Anderson provides inspiration for colourful late season containers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's in the jewel garden showing which plants need protection from the elements now and which ones can be left until after the first frosts. He also plants out berried shrubs to help feed wildlife in the winter, harvests pumpkins and shows how to make use of fallen autumnal leaves.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares the flowering borders for winter and makes a bonfire, Carol celebrates our berry-laden hedgerows, and Rachel visits Julian Clary in his garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the last programme of the current series, Monty Don takes stock of his year at Longmeadow. We visit RHS Wisley to learn why autumn leaves are such a precious commodity for our gardens, and in the final instalment of her botany series, Carol Klein celebrates the glorious displays put on by flowering plants to attract pollinators.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As autumn gathers momentum, it's time to start putting the garden to bed for winter. Monty Don has some timely advice on what to do. Carol Klein meets a nurseryman in Herefordshire and together they indulge in the beauty of the Japanese maple.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the clocks going forward this weekend, there's an extra hour of gardening to enjoy. Monty makes the most of this as he begins to sow dahlia seeds for summer flowers, reveals a new project and shows what to plant now in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the cottage garden, Monty is moving a rose which has outgrown its space and in the vegetable garden he gives advice on what to plant now for spring. He also finds out more about the mysterious world of earthworms and discovers why they are vital for the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at Longmeadow, preparing for the seasons to come. He demonstrates a quick and easy way to prune shrub roses and then plants up pots that will flower in time for Christmas. Grasses look their best at the end of summer and Carol Klein visits a garden in Somerset where they have been used to maximum effect on a sloping site with a range of soil conditions.

programme.desc: The guys move across the south hunting ducks in Texas and Oklahoma ahead of a major push of cold weather across the country.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: With record low temperatures in the forecast, the Black Cloud crew hits the timber for one last hunt before the freeze. Some days hunting ducks in the Timber is all about your calling and decoy spread... some days you're on the X and none of that matters.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: After a great sandhill hunt in Oklahoma, Mark is headed down to Georgia's Lake Seminole. This big body of water houses a large concentration of Canvasbacks during the winter months. It's the first time on the journey that Mark has only gone after one species. The list has a lot of checkmarks now, but this hunt proves to be one of the biggest challenges yet.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: It's 2016 and Mark heads down to Kansas for an early season Muzzleloader Whitetail hunt with Salt River Outfitters. It was hot in the stand with little deer movement until the moon phase switched and one of the bucks Mark had been looking for stepped out. Kansas is one of those states that has an early Muzzleloader season that opens in September, and if you can get the weather and the moon to align you can catch a big deer on his feet in daylight.

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: One of the boys of '67, Steve Hopper details his experiences as part of Charlie Company's war in Vietnam.

programme.title: Sail Kings

programme.desc: Mitch Widom, Andy Yaffa, & Chris Hammaway join Capt. Jared Raskob in Los Cabos on the hunt for Striped Marlin Part 2.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Behind The Draw
programme.desc: When you think of hunting Colorado, Big Whitetails might not necessarily come to mind. However, Mike is very familiar with Eastern Colorado and the whitetails here specifically. He has hunted with his friends that run this ranch for years now and helped them manage this special piece of land. There is an absolutely, incredible age class of deer that live here with some of the most unique hunting Colorado has to offer. In this particular story Mike takes his bow-hunt down to the final day of his hunt while he is after a certain buck they've nicknamed "Buddy".

programme.title: HUnting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade ends the saga with a deer he has watched for a few years, Pope. On a previous episode you saw Slade put in all of the work with feeder and food plot strategy to make the stars align. Make sure you watch that episode as well to see the behind the scenes work it took to bring Pope to 25 yards.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: On this weeks episode of Hunting Land Man, Slade and his daughter Asa take on the turkey woods together for the first time. As this is Asa's first time turkey hunting some quick pre hunt preparations are in order. Slade also was able to sit down with a good friend and registered forester to talk fire and the benefits of fire in land management. The next day, Asa and Slade were able to connect with a thundering tom as Asa punched her first ever turkey tag!

programme.title: The Hunted Land & Sea
programme.desc: Kristian's father Kim Hansen and close friend Gerry Holland travel to Kona for some deep-sea fishing aboard the “Kona Blue” with long time friend Caption Marlin Kahl.

programme.title: Canadian Whitetail
programme.desc: A packed episode with 3 hunts from the Hayworth Family with some wild footage of BIG Whitetails.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Hunting has a way of grounding us, reminding us of what truly matters: shared moments and unforgettable memories. Chance and Ashleigh Eckert are on their first out-of-state hunt in the rolling hills of Ohio. After overcoming a life-changing kidney transplant, their story is one of faith, love, and resilience. While the goal was a big buck, the true reward was the time spent together and the lessons learned along the way. Because hunting is about so much more than the harvest — it’s about the journey.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jeff Lindsey has always had one dream as a land owner, and after over a decade of managing his Illinois farm, his dream finally came true—a MEGA 200" giant buck! This story began three years ago when Jeff passed on this deer at just 26 yards. Back then, he was a 175" 4.5-year-old stud, but he took a gamble and let him walk... hoping he’d one day break the magical 200" mark.

programme.title: Bearded Buck
programme.desc: In this episode, Jerry and Austin are still in Nebraska hunting whitetails and muleys. After Jerry filled the first mule deer tag of the trip, the weather takes a turn for the worst and the deer movement slows down drastically. With just five days left in the trip to come up with a new game plan to figure out these whitetails and Austin's number one target mule deer, Jerry and Austin are worried that they may leave without filling another tag.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and Jeff Hutchinson head to Maryland to bow-fish for an invasive, toothy fish called the snakehead. They learn how this fish, a native of Asia, made its way to the United States. They also learn from the locals, despite its appearance, it is one tasty fish.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green meets up with some friends at the Idaho Fish and Game Department to ice fish for cutthroat trout. Looking to test the results of previous restocking efforts, they'll be heading to some of the most remote lakes in the state only accessible by snowmobile.
